intro: Pentataenium daralaghezicum, commonly known as the Daralaghezic pentatena, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Turkey. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
